hierarchy.entry_domain: Container and Cloud Supply Chain Security

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a zero-trust model, debate the trade-offs of using mTLS versus JWT for service-to-service authentication in a Kubernetes service mesh. How does this impact supply chain risk management in containerized environments? (Encourage critical thinking by requiring evidence from NIST SP 800-204A and real-world breach examples like lateral movement in SolarWinds).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Service Mesh Security within the topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) > Container and Cloud Supply Chain Security > Kubernetes and Orchestration Security > Service Mesh Security. Incorporate this research context: Service Mesh is an infrastructure layer for microservices communication (traffic management, observability, security via proxies). Key: Data Plane (traffic handling, e.g., Envoy), Control Plane (configuration). Security: Zero Trust, mTLS (mutual auth), ABAC (attribute-based), JWT (RFC 7519). NIST SP 800-204A (secure microservices with service-mesh proxies); NIST SP 800-233 (SCRM for supply chains). Best practices: Cert rotation, sidecar injection. Misconceptions: Data/control confusion, mTLS=TLS. Use these exact learning objectives [insert learning_objectives array here]. Structure content via scaffolding layers [insert scaffolding array here]. Generate flashcards following this schema exactly [insert flashcard_schema.structure here]. Protocol: [insert flashcard_schema.generation_protocol here]. Enhance with active learning ties (e.g., reference discussion on mTLS trade-offs). Prior knowledge: Link to Kubernetes pods/services and load balancers. Big picture: Secures container supply chains against runtime breaches. Output ONLY a JSON array of 25 flashcards, each as a parsable object. No other text.
